name: Breakfast Sausage
headline: Breakfast Sausage
description: Make a batch of Alton Brown's homemade Breakfast Sausage for Food Network.
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds pork butt (2 1/2 pounds with bone), diced into 1/4-inch pieces
1/2 pound fat back, diced into 1/4-inch pieces
2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh sage leaves
2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh thyme leaves
1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh rosemary leaves

recipeInstructions.text: Combine diced pork with all other ingredients and chill for 1 hour. Using the fine blade of a grinder, grind the pork. Form into 1-inch rounds. Refrigerate and use within 1 week or freeze for up to 3 months. For immediate use, saute patties over medium-low heat in a non-stick pan. Saute until brown and cooked through, approximately 10 to 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I just made this with venison and it came out incredible, only change I made was a little more fat since venison is so lean. Pro tip, while meat is chilling in fridge put your grinder attachment in the freezer helps keep fat from dissolving.

I just tried 3 different recipes for breakfast sausage for a taste test - this one, a Jimmy Dean copycat and a Bob Evans copycat. This was definitely the best. I added 1/4t garlic powder and 1/4t onion powder as one reviewer suggested. I will cut down on salt by 1/2 t next time - personal preference. Damn Covid and US/Canada border closure has this southern girl missing lots of comfort foods, so thanks for the recipe Alton! Now on to the biscuits and gravy.....
Made this with Beyond Meat ground, and the seasonings in this recipe helped me to turn out a fantastic plant-based alternative to putting a piglet into a grinder.Â  Delicious!
